page.title: 08The River Black Bourn
page.content: The River Black Bourn runs through the farmland to the East of the village. Near the old Watermill is a ford now accompanied by a nearby light bridge. There were a lot of reeds by the side and in the middle of the river. About a foot away from the river's edge was a big patch of nettles which stretched as far as I could see. A little way up the river were some water lilies in flower. On one of the sides of the river was a sort of dock-leaved plant. On the other side of the river was a mill pond. The mill pond had dried up into marsh land, and lots of weeds are growing there now. On our walk today on high ground North of Honington I did not find any proper rivers but I did find a concrete filled ditch, a polluted ditch, and a big duck-pond.
